title: Keramic Studio (may 1900) - A Monthly Magazine for The Designer,
description:
Year: 1900
Pages: 348
Size: 30 MB
Format: pdf

Keramic Studio is a monthly Arts Crafts era magazine for pottery, china, and porcelain decorating and design. In 1899, it was founded and edited by Adelaide Alsop Robineau, one of the premier ceramicists in America, and creator of the famed "Scarab Vase". Robineau  was a tireless promoter of the studio pottery and china painting movements, and her magazine is a valuable source of information on potters, techniques and potting-related news and designs of the period.
